@graph.name: The Cookie Rookie®
@graph.description: Easy Recipes anyone can make, that everyone will love!

@graph.caption: Pumpkin Brownies are an easy fall dessert recipe perfect for Halloween or Thanksgiving. Add a layer of pumpkin to your brownies for something fun and delicious!

@graph.name: Pumpkin Brownies - Super Easy Fall Dessert Recipe - {VIDEO!!!}
@graph.description: Pumpkin Brownies are an easy fall dessert recipe perfect for Halloween or Thanksgiving. Add a layer of pumpkin to brownies for something fun & delicious!

@graph.name: Becky Hardin
@graph.description: Becky woke up on her 30th birthday and realized she didn't know how to cook, ANYTHING! She started The Cookie Rookie as a way to document her journey to learn how to cook, one recipe at a time! The Cookie Rookie is a place to find easy recipes that anyone can make, and everyone will love!

@graph.name: Pumpkin Brownies
@graph.description: Pumpkin Brownies are the perfect mix of two of my favorite desserts: chocolate and pumpkin pie! This easy brownie recipe uses a boxed brownie mix of your choice with a layer of pumpkin in the middle to create something super fun and delicious. And they look really pretty too! I'm always looking for more easy fall desserts, and these brownies are perfect for Halloween, Thanksgiving, or any autumn party.

video.name: Pumpkin Brownies
video.description: Pumpkin Brownies are the perfect mix of two of my favorite desserts: chocolate and pumpkin pie! This easy brownie recipe uses a boxed brownie mix of your choice with a layer of pumpkin in the middle to create something super fun and delicious. And they look really pretty too! I'm always looking for more easy fall desserts, and these brownies are perfect for Halloween, Thanksgiving, or any autumn party.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to whatever instructions are on the brownie mix box. 350F works well.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat your oven to whatever instructions are on the brownie mix box. 350F works well.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the brownie mix in a separate bowl. Follow the directions on the box. Add the chocolate chips to the brownie mix. Stir them in and set the bowl and set to the side.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the brownie mix in a separate bowl. Follow the directions on the box. Add the chocolate chips to the brownie mix. Stir them in and set the bowl and set to the side.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the pumpkin, cream cheese (softened), sugar, and pumpkin pie spice in another bowl. Mix until very smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the pumpkin, cream cheese (softened), sugar, and pumpkin pie spice in another bowl. Mix until very smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray your pan with cooking spray before starting. Pour half of the brownie mix into the pan and spread out so the entire bottom of the pan is covered.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray your pan with cooking spray before starting. Pour half of the brownie mix into the pan and spread out so the entire bottom of the pan is covered.

recipeInstructions.text: Next add the pumpkin. You can either spoon the pumpkin filling onto the brownie in chunks or spread it out evenly. Cover the pumpkin with the rest of the brownie batter and smooth out the top.
recipeInstructions.name: Next add the pumpkin. You can either spoon the pumpkin filling onto the brownie in chunks or spread it out evenly. Cover the pumpkin with the rest of the brownie batter and smooth out the top.

recipeInstructions.text: Now you're ready to bake! I added 10 minutes to the directions on the box (cooked for 35 minutes for my pan size). Since you're adding quite a bit of depth with the pumpkin mix...you'll need to cook longer. To check if brownies are done...dip a fork into the middle of the brownies. If the fork comes out clean...they’re done! Enjoy!
